info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 10:04PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
At 1003 PM MDT...A snow squall was along a line extending from 8 miles north of Wild Horse Ranch to Egbert...and moving southeast at 40 mph.
HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and visibilities less than one mile.
SOURCE...Radar and Webcams.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities.
This dangerous squall will be near... Warren AFB, North Crow Campground, Federal, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, Tie City Campground, Frontier Park, Hillsdale, North Cheyenne, Laramie, and Burns around 1010 PM MDT. Fox Farm-College, Happy Valley, Granite Springs Retreat, and Curt Gowdy State Park around 1015 PM MDT. Granite Springs Reservoir and South Greeley Highway around 1020 PM MDT. Carpenter and Crystal Lake Reservoir around 1025 PM MDT. South Cheyenne and Pine Grove Estates around 1030 PM MDT. Vedauwoo, Vedauwoo Campground, and Bison Crossing around 1035 PM MDT. Winchester Hills around 1045 PM MDT.
Other locations impacted by this dangerous squall include Paddocks, Cowboy Ranch South, Pope Springs, Grass Hills, Albany County Fairgrounds, and Cheyenne Pass.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 2 and 26. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 294 and 391.
info.instruction:
Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas!
LAT...LON 4102 10540 4102 10418 4132 10434 4144 10603 TIME...MOT...LOC 0403Z 293DEG 49KT 4138 10589 4116 10428

parameter.value: A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN ALBANY AND SOUTHERN LARAMIE COUNTIES

area.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Central Laramie County; East Laramie County
